reviews.review_msg: Had him for ENSC 251 and he was great, he follows a similar course structure here as well with a group project and labs.  His lecturing isn't the best though and the midterm exam was crazy difficult. Overall supplement with the textbook for concepts and put in a decent amount of hours for the labs/project.
It was really hard to understand his explanations. Just read the textbook.
Most people basically stopped going to classes after the first few weeks because of this guy
I had prof fang for 251 and he was decent there but 254 with him was really confusing
He gets a 2 because he's better than Craig.

There were several classes where Zhenman acted like he was seeing his own lecture slides for the first time. His first class was actually all about class logistics and keeping things organized, but he didn't really follow through.

Is that Zhenman giving himself a positive review? He can't spell the simplest words in his lecture slides just like he can't spell "brainless". This class was not hard, but it was so disorganized that the simplest concepts took hours to understand. This is probably going to be one of those classes I look back on and wonder why it was so confusing.

Great class. Lectures were not mandatory as they were recorded on Zoom, which was nice. Lots of homework and labs, but these are easy to get good marks on and make up a good chunk of your grade. Labs and final project were perfectly fine besides a few file replacements. The people complaining about it are brainlets that can't follow instructions.

Lecture slides are full of mistakes which he has to constantly fix during class. It's obvious that he doesn't prepare for lecture at all. Final project was also a mess and the provided code was full of bugs that the he and the TAs had to keep updating. Disappointing course overall.
Never forget the hyphen/underscore incident and WorkDist-1 incident.
Doesn't really care if the students are learning. He says he wants feedback but doesn't listen to what the students are telling him.
Great professor, and amazing TAs this term. He is kind of dry but if you pay attention or even just go over the slides you'll know everything you need to.

I took 251 and I am taking 254 with him this semester. He is really nice professor, he is good in teaching and cares about his students. He really tries that everyone has the opportunity to learn. He is very organized. If you ever have a concern don't be shy and try talk to him, he is very kind and helpful.

Dr. Fang is a man of reason and honour. He will give you a good grade if you simply show up to classes and keep up with all the labs/homework. Yes, this course is time consuming, but you cannot have the mentality of thinking that group projects are 100% 50/50. Expect to put in more effort than what you think you will do if you want to succeed.

Although the course work is difficult, Zhenman's grading scheme made it easy to do well, given you complete all the assignments (I think half the class got an A without any scaling). He's also very approachable for questions and usually explains concepts well. Don't be afraid to ask him about anything you're unsure about, course-related or not.

Great professor from both a research and practical perspective. Class teaches very unique subjects that is not found in any other ENSC class. Makes people do presentations to enforce understanding, including one on cutting-edge research. Class is the only one from ENSC that feels like it's from the current decade and not the last century.

Horrible boring Lectures, 80% of the class skipped his lectures(according to him) and that's not even the biggest issue. HIs grading schemes are nonexistent, so you might put your heart and soul into a project and fail, but put together a trash code and submit and get a decent mark. It's chance, and most of the time it won't be on your side.
